div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Joseph A. LePrince, May 17, 1915
div1.p:
Day before yesterday I had to undergo a minor operation--hae-
morrhoids--and am naturally flat on my back in bed. However, there
seemed nothing else to do.

I will try to leave this place Monday evening, May 24th.,
which should put me in Montgomery Tuesday night. I will come on the
9.55 from Atlanta. I have no idea what hotel to go to. If you know
write me by return mail and I will go there, for if we can meet that
night we probably can catch an early train to Clanton. If you do
not get this in time we will meet at Sanders' office Wednesday as
soon as it is open. If, by any chance, I miss I will wire you care
of the hotel if you write me, or of Sanders if you do not.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Assistant Surgeon-General. Will wait at Montgomery
HRC/LC.
